page.title: 15SHOPPING:NORTH NORFOLK:Cont
page.content: Dairy products can all be bought from supermarkets for economy and convenience, although there are also daily milk deliveries in the area. Cheese can be bought prepacked or loose. Fruit and vegetables, if not homegrown are bought at a greengrocer's or a supermarket. It is possible, however, to buy produce in season from roadside stalls, which are usualy of excellent quality and value, although a regular supply from such sources cannot be guaranteed. Eggs can be purchased at a variety of shops, depending on whether battery or free-range eggs are preferred. {SHOPPING IN NORTH NORFOLK} Fish is bought at a specialist fish shop. In the coastal villages there are often stalls if a fisherman has made a good catch.
